sourceMeaningMnemonic:
The <radical>height</radical> radical and the <kanji>height</kanji> kanji are the same!

That said, there's a secondary meaning to this kanji of <kanji>ten feet</kanji>. So, when you think of height, think of that height as being ten feet tall.
meaningInfo: If you paid attention in radicals school, you'll be able to learn this kanji meaning easily.
readingMnemonic: When you think of <kanji>height</kanji> think of our huge farmhand friend, <reading>Jou</reading>rm (<ja>じょう</ja>). He's a big guy, and he has a lot of height to him. In fact, he's <kanji>ten feet</kanji> tall.
readingInfo: Jourm really is a big guy. Look up at him, and try to measure him, but ten feet is too high for you to reach.
